title: Opera singer David Daniels pleads guilty in sexual assault trial
description: The world-renowned countertenor and his husband were accused of drugging and raping a young singer in 2010.

title: An appeals court blocks Mississippi's permanent ban on voting after certain felonies
description: Mississippi is violating the U.S. Constitution by permanently stripping voting rights from people convicted of some felonies, a divided federal appeals court panel ruled. The state plans to appeal.

title: NBA players' union says Orlando Magic donation to a DeSantis super PAC is 'alarming'
description: The team donated $50,000 to a super PAC that backs the Florida governor's presidential ambitions, The union said team donations should reflect the diversity of values of the players.

title: California's Mammoth Mountain is wrapping up its second-longest season after 275 days
description: Atmospheric rivers brought record-breaking snowfall to the mountain over the winter, allowing the resort to stay open into August. It will close just shy of 100 days before the new season starts.

title: These military spouses are fighting one senator's hold on military promotions
description: Sen. Tommy Tuberville's disagreement with a Pentagon policy on abortion is upheaving life plans for hundreds of military families. Now those families are petitioning Senate leaders to intervene.

title: Actor Mark Margolis, drug kingpin on 'Breaking Bad' and 'Better Call Saul,' dies
description: He played murderous Hector Salamanca and was nominated for an Emmy in 2012.

title: The case for a soft landing in the economy just got another boost
description: U.S. employers added 187,000 jobs in July, a slower but still solid pace of growth, suggesting the Federal Reserve may be able to curb inflation without triggering a recession.

title: Long-time Jane Doe in Gilgo Beach serial killings is identified
description: Karen Vergata was one of four people who were left unidentified for years after their remains were found. The development comes three weeks after a suspect in a string of killings was arrested.

title: The Ring Nebula comes into focus, and it's astounding
description: Thanks to the James Webb telescope, we can now see the nebula with more clarity. As one expert says, "We always knew planetary nebulae were pretty. What we see now is spectacular."

title: Simone Biles returns to competition this weekend for the first time since Tokyo
description: Biles' return is great news for USA Gymnastics, which just announced a new sponsorship deal with Nike. Also returning is Suni Lee, who took home the Olympic all-around gold after Biles dropped out.

title: Roller coaster riders rescued from 205-foot drop amid mechanical issues
description: The Magnum XL-200 at Ohio's Cedar Point amusement park promises high speeds and fast turns. Thrill-seekers got a little extra excitement when the ride stopped at the top of its signature plunge.

title: Hyundai and Kia recall nearly 92,000 cars and urge outdoor parking due to fire risk
description: Several Hyundai and Kia models are being recalled over faulty oil pumps that can overheat and cause fires — less than five months since the two automakers recalled vehicles due to another fire hazard.

title: Russian opposition activist Navalny is sentenced to 19 more years in prison
description: The Russian activist, a fierce opponent of President Vladimir Putin, was sentenced Friday on extremism charges, which he denies. He is already serving prison sentences on other charges he denies.

title: The economy added jobs at a solid pace in July, reinforcing hopes about the economy
description: U.S. employers added 187,000 jobs in July, still marking a steady pace of growth. The unemployment rate edged down to 3.5%.

title: Up First briefing: Trump pleads not guilty; July job numbers; Women's World Cup
description: Former President Donald Trump pleads not guilty to four felony counts. Forecasters predict the job market stayed strong in July. The Women's World Cup knockout round begins tomorrow.

title: At Yemeni prosthetics clinic, the patients keep coming even though the war has slowed
description: The civil war in Yemen seems to be cooling off, but its deadly legacy of land mines will be felt for decades. At a prosthetics clinic near the the front line, children bear a disproportionate burden.

title: Antarctica has a lot less sea ice than usual. That's bad news for all of us
description: It's the middle of the winter in Antarctica, when the ocean around the continent freezes. But this year there's less sea ice than ever recorded.

title: Voters could decide the future of abortion access in Florida
description: Activists on both sides of Florida's abortion access debate are working towards ballot measures that would enshrine their views in the state constitution.

title: 56 death-row inmates are asking Louisiana's governor to commute their sentences
description: Gov. John Bel Edwards, a Democrat, recently said he is against the death penalty. Now a legal effort is racing to get requests for clemency to Edwards before he leaves office.

title: Raising money and poll numbers, Donald Trump stays 'Teflon Don' amid indictments
description: In 2016, then-candidate Donald Trump claimed he could shoot someone and not lose any voters. Now, he faces criminal charges in three separate indictments, and voters continue to support "Teflon Don."

title: Scientists want you to mail dead butterflies for research if you live in these states
description: The USGS wants to test if butterflies and other insects are being hurt by contaminants, such as those in pesticides. It's seeking specimens from Alabama, Georgia, Kansas, Nebraska, Oklahoma and Texas.

title: A landmark study opens a new possible way for Black Americans to trace their ancestry
description: Researchers have compared the DNA of 27 Black people who lived at the Catoctin furnace between 1774 and 1850, finding a link between these enslaved Americans and nearly 42,000 living relatives.

title: Who's in, who's out and storylines to watch in the Women's World Cup round of 16
description: The Women's World Cup says goodbye to Germany and Brazil and welcome to Morocco and Jamaica. Here are the teams and games to watch as the tournament's knockout stage begins.

title: When Black boaters faced discrimination on the water, this yacht club became a refuge
description: When the Seafarers Yacht Club of Annapolis was founded in 1959, discrimination at fuel docks around the famous port was common. Today, the club is thriving and giving back to the community.

title: Filling Fauci's shoes: Dr. Jeanne Marrazzo is HIV expert and a lot of fun at parties
description: Dr. Jeanne Marrazzo, a professor at the University of Alabama at Birmingham, will lead NIH's infectious diseases institute. Colleagues say she has a wide breadth of knowledge and a joyful demeanor.

title: Ex-Biden official's lawsuit against Fox echoes case that led to big settlement
description: Fox devoted 300 segments over an 8-month period to a disinformation researcher named Nina Jankowicz who joined the Biden administration. She says the coverage distorted her work and led her to resign.

title: Weekly news quiz: from co-conspirators to a conspiracy about a bear suit
description: From bears to break-ups and a thrice-indicted former president, there was lots to talk about this week. Were you paying attention?

title: When temps rise, so do medical risks. Should doctors and nurses talk more about heat?
description: The medical dangers of heat are real. But people often ignore public heat alerts, or don't know how vulnerable they are. A new alert system prompts clinicians to talk about heat with patients.

title: 6 white ex-officers in Mississippi plead guilty to assault on 2 Black men
description: Kristen Clarke of the Justice Department said the Mississippi officers "caused harm to the entire community who feel that they can't trust the police officers who are supposed to serve them."

title: The 2 expelled members of the 'Tennessee 3' win back their state House seats
description: Tennessee Reps. Justin Pearson and Justin Jones advanced Thursday through a special election to fully reclaim their positions.

title: 2 U.S. Navy sailors charged with providing sensitive military information to China
description: The two U.S. sailors, both based in California, were charged with similar moves to provide sensitive intelligence to the Chinese.
